climbs.name: Sierra Wave
climbs.fa: Belen Ladd, Howard Ballou, Joshua Reinig

content.description: Sierra Wave climbs the downward right facing broken flake system just right of Meteorology.The crux comes in the first 15 feet pulling around a small mountain mahogany and continues as a beautiful but tricky 5.7 to the top. You have three different top out variations after the first 30 meters to choose from. Even better run Laps on all three!!
content.location: Obvious right facing broken flake system 30' to the right of Meteorology 20' left of Alpine Breeze.

content.description: This is the cool overhanging crack system to juggy lichen covered green arete. Not the best of climbs on the formation but with more traffic will clean up beautifully.
content.location: Northwest arete of formation. belay from tree. Walk off.

content.description:
The Super Mondo Moon Dike! Dude like wow, sh*t Bro, supa stellar clean radicl run-out-ness to the max!!!

This route is amazing start to finish. Launching off onto the Moon Dike from your last piece, is a super exciting adventure into your Psyche you will not soon forget.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3". Gear/Bush anchor. Walk off back.
content.location: The Moon Dike is obviously seen when standing back from the start of Cumulonimbus, up and right. To reach this amazing Sun Dike-esque feature, start directly at the very large pine growing from the base of the formation. It will be a 5.6 overhung jugy boulder problem into a splitter hand crack for 40'. This will take you directly to the sequence that gets you blasting off onto the Dike!

climbs.name: Meteorology
climbs.fa: Joshua Reinig, Howard Ballou, Nicolas Fitzpatrick

content.description: The crux to this route comes early on and is extremely sequential, with only a couple of crap pieces to protect it well below your feet. As you pull through the tough bit you will be rewarded with brilliant protect-able face climbing up a left trending seam. Once this beautiful dance of lie backing right, then left, then right again peters out, follow face features straight up to the top. Better yet step right and climb off width and hand crack/groove to the top.
content.location: Meteorology is the most obvious proudest line going up the most predominant part of the West face.

climbs.name: Fitz's Folly
climbs.fa: Nicolas Fitzpatrick, Howard Ballou and Joshua Reinig

content.description: Fitz's Folly climbs the varied weakness up the far right side of the west face. This route can be described as bushy, good cracks, good pro.,and is the only route on the formation you must pitch out. Second pitch is the closest thing you can get to climbing consolidated brown sugar as you climb an exposed and extremely rotten arete, to gain the true summit of the Real Cloud Ripper Tower.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3". top of tower is slung with TAT.
content.location: Obvious bushy weakness up right side of the west face.

content.description: Cumulus climbs the obvious cleft to splitter hand crack just right of cumulonimbus. The hand crack quickly ends and puts you into a boulder problem, large but sloping holds will get you to a thank god diagonal off width. Once diagonal right tending off width ends follow jug haul to the top.

Cumulonimbus is an epic protectable jug haul of a Route. Nearly dead vertical with a couple cool bulges to pull, this route has all the great qualities of the Left Ski Track at Tahquitz all packed into one 70m pitch.
content.protection: Standard rack, tree anchor. Walk off back!
content.location: This route is the obviouse beautiful jug haul of a face, on the far left of this formations proud West Face. Just right of the Northwest ArÃªte.

content.description: AP can be described as a bitchen jug and sloper haul, up a beautiful canvas of a face. Although protection is sparse it is all there. There are two variations to start this route. The first being just right of the start of Moon Dike. The other start is the same as Meteorology but before the crux of this route follow a left trending diagonal crack/mini ledge system. Both variations merge just before the wild edgy face climbing, before crossing the end of The Moon Dike.
content.location: featured face between Moon Dike and Meteorology.

climbs.name: Alpine Breeze
climbs.fa: Belen Ladd, Howard Hammerland, Joshua Reinig

content.description: Alpine Breeze is the easiest and least committing route on the whole formation. Non the less is still a mellow worthwhile Cruz up wonderful features. Although originally done as a single 30 meter pitch ending as you merge into Fitz's folly at the tree. It is possible to finish up FF at 5.7 as Alpine Breeze merges into the route right at the crux.
content.location: 20' left of Fit's Folly 15' right of Sierra Breeze.
